items.title: Sebi bans First Overseas Capital for two years
items.description: Sebi has banned First Overseas Capital from the securities market and new IPO mandates for two years, imposing a ₹20 lakh fine. The regulator found the merchant banker violated norms by not maintaining adequate net worth, exceeding underwriting limits, and engaging in non-securities business. These actions followed an inspection revealing multiple regulatory breaches.

items.title: Stocks in news: ITC Hotels, Dr Reddy's, SBI Life, Hero MotoCorp, Vedanta
items.description: Markets traded volatile on Thursday, ending nearly unchanged after early gains were erased by profit-taking in heavyweight stocks. Analysts suggest a short-term consolidation phase is likely, with Nifty holding above 25,600 considered healthy. Several companies, including Vedanta, Hero MotoCorp, and Colgate-Palmolive, are in focus due to investment plans, international expansion, and Q2 results.

items.title: Trade pact possibilities boost Indian export stocks amid market rally
items.description: Indian exporters, particularly in IT and textiles, saw a significant surge on Thursday following reports of an impending India-US trade pact. This potential deal could drastically lower US tariffs on Indian goods, boosting export prospects.

items.title: Indices rise for sixth consecutive day amid US trade deal optimism
items.description: Indian stock markets closed higher for the sixth consecutive day. Gains were fueled by positive reports on trade negotiations between India and the US. Information Technology stocks saw a significant rise. While Reliance Industries shares declined, the overall market sentiment remained optimistic. Investors are awaiting concrete outcomes from the trade deal discussions.

items.title: Stock Radar: SBI hits fresh record highs in October 2025; will the rally continue in November?
items.description: State Bank of India has broken out of a consolidation range, hitting fresh highs and suggesting further rally potential. Experts recommend buying on dips towards Rs 900 for targets above Rs 1,000 in the next 1-2 months, citing bullish technical indicators and outperformance in the PSU banking sector.

items.title: RBI proposes to mandate UTI for all OTC derivative transactions
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India is shaking up the financial landscape with a groundbreaking rule coming into effect next fiscal year. Beginning then, all over-the-counter derivative trades related to rupee interest rates and foreign exchange currencies will need a Unique Transaction Identifier. This identifier is designed to offer regulators better insights into transaction trends and market health.

items.title: 6 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: As of October 23, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for six stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 9% compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Infosys, TCS and 3 other stocks that show bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On October 23, five largecap stocks on the NSE were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting a strengthening momentum in the stock's price. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify opportunities for buying.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Morgan Stanley maintains Equal-Weight on Bharat Forge; Citi raises target price on Hindustan Unilever
items.description: Brokerages show mixed views on consumer and manufacturing stocks; HUL and Colgate retain Buy ratings with revised targets, while Bharat Forge faces international headwinds despite strong defence orders boosting near-term prospects.

items.title: HUL shares decline 5% as brokerages turn cautious post Q2 show. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: HUL shares fell after Q2 FY26 net profit rose 3.6% to Rs 2,685 crore, mainly due to a one-off tax gain, while brokers flagged margin pressures and subdued operational performance.

items.title: Sensex slips over 100 pts, Nifty below 25,900 as doubts cloud US-India trade deal
items.description: Indian stock markets opened on a subdued note this Friday. The Sensex and Nifty saw a slight dip after reaching near record highs. The rally from Thursday lost momentum as optimism about a US-India trade deal waned. The Indian government did not confirm reports of an imminent agreement. Markets are now awaiting further developments.

items.title: Late starter Mukesh Ambani crashes quick commerce party. Can Reliance disrupt Blinkit, Swiggy, Zepto's 10-minute game?
items.description: Reliance Retail has entered India’s 10-minute delivery race with JioMart, leveraging 3,000 stores as delivery hubs and 600 dark stores in top cities. The platform added 5.8 million customers in one quarter, recording 42% sequential growth and a 200% YoY jump in daily orders, signaling a major push into quick commerce and intensified competition with Blinkit, Zepto, and Swiggy Instamart.

items.title: Premier Energies, Syrma SGS shares in focus on JV to acquire KSolare Energy for Rs 170 crore
items.description: Premier Energies and Syrma SGS Technologies will be in focus on October 24 after announcing a joint acquisition of Pune-based solar inverter maker KSolare Energy for Rs 170 crore. Premier Energies will take a 51% stake and Syrma SGS 49%, with KSolare becoming a subsidiary of Premier Energies. The deal is expected to close within 90 days, subject to approvals.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp shares in focus on entering UK market with MotoGB partnership
items.description: Hero MotoCorp shares: The company enters the UK market, launching its Euro 5+ Hunk 440 motorcycle through a partnership with MotoGB, marking its 51st global market.

items.title: BDL, BML & other defence stocks rally up to 4% after DAC clears Rs 79,000 crore capital acquisition proposals
items.description: Defence stocks rallied as the Defence Acquisition Council approved capital acquisition proposals worth approximately Rs 79,000 crore for the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force. These approvals aim to bolster India's defence preparedness with advanced weapons systems, mobility platforms, and surveillance equipment across all domains.

items.title: Oil India, ONGC, BPCL, other oil-sensitive stocks in focus as US sanctions on Russia send crude prices soaring
items.description: Shares of oil and gas firms including Oil India, ONGC, Indian Oil, and BPCL are in focus after crude oil surged over 5% overnight, heading for its strongest weekly gain since mid-June. The rally followed U.S. sanctions on Russia’s top oil producers, raising supply concerns. Analysts cite OPEC+ meetings and U.S.-India talks on Russian oil as key near-term factors.

items.title: Vodafone Idea among 4 stocks flashing bullish signals, hinting at possible uptrend
items.description: On October 23, among NSE stocks with a market capitalization of over Rs 10,000 crore, four stocks appeared on the bullish scanner with a “White Marubozu” pattern, according to StockEdge's technical scan data.A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It forms when the opening price is the lowest of the period and the closing price is the highest, represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow. This indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers controlled the market from open to close, often using the pattern to make informed decisions on future price movements.

items.title: Nifty rally fuels renewed optimism; analysts eye 30,800 as medium-term target
items.description: The Nifty 50 and Sensex touched near-record highs, fueled by festive-season optimism, supportive policies, and expectations of robust corporate earnings. Positive FII inflows and optimism around a potential India–U.S. trade deal further boosted sentiment. Technical analysts highlight bullish breakouts, including a Cup and Handle pattern, pointing to medium-term Nifty targets of 30,800, though near-term volatility cannot be ruled out.

items.title: BGR Energy, GM Breweries among 7 stocks witnessing 5-year swing high breakouts
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market capitalisation of over Rs 1,000 crore, six counters hit their 5-year swing highs at the close on October 23, signalling bullish momentum, according to data from StockEdge's technical scan.A 5-year swing high marks the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year period. This level often acts as a key resistance zone where prices have previously struggled to break through. Reaching this point is typically viewed as a bullish signal, suggesting potential for further upside. However, it differs from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when the stock decisively surpasses that resistance level.Stocks hitting 5-year swing highs:

items.title: Colgate-Palmolive shares slide 4% after Q2 profit falls 17% YoY, brokerages trim target price
items.description: In a challenging turn of events, Colgate-Palmolive India's shares took a hit as the company reported a 17% decline in net profit for the September quarter, alongside a drop in revenue. The decline was attributed to recent changes in the Goods and Services Tax rates affecting oral care products.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 10 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 10 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 23, 2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Dalmia Bharat, RIL among 5 stocks that could give 15-69% return
items.description: Brokerages remain optimistic on select names across sectors, highlighting opportunities in cement, engineering, renewables, energy, and specialty chemicals for the next 12 months.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Auto parts boom ahead: 10 stocks to ride India’s $200 billion component market by 2030
items.description: India’s auto component industry is gearing up for a high-growth run, projected to expand at an 18% CAGR to $200 billion by 2030, driven by robust domestic demand, exports, and EV adoption. Analysts say several listed suppliers are well-positioned to benefit from this cycle. Here are 10 stocks with the highest upside potential, according to Trendlyne.

items.title: Hitachi Energy among 6 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: As of October 23, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for six stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 9% compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Tamo turns TMPV! Tata Motors shares get a new name from today after the demerger
items.description: Starting October 24, Tata Motors’ passenger vehicle business will trade as Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles (TMPV), completing the renaming process following its demerger. The commercial vehicle operations will continue under the original Tata Motors name, while TMPV will include EVs and Jaguar Land Rover (JLR). The change reflects the company’s strategy to list PV and CV operations separately.

items.title: BOJ likely to hold rates amid persistent inflation
items.description: Core consumer prices in Japan have risen above the Bank of Japan’s 2% target, keeping the market alert to potential interest rate changes. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Laurus Labs shares tumble 4% despite 886% surge in Q2 PAT. Should you buy the dip?
items.description: Laurus Labs shares fell despite Q2FY26 PAT surging 886% to Rs 195 crore, revenue rising 35%, and EBITDA more than doubling, with margins expanding to 24.4%.

items.title: Mutual funds double stake in Paytm shares in just 6 quarters, but retail investors flee. Who's smart?
items.description: Indian mutual funds have more than doubled their stake in One97 Communications, Paytm’s parent, rising to 16.25% in September 2025 from 6.8% in June 2024, while retail investors trimmed holdings for the sixth consecutive quarter. The shift reflects renewed institutional confidence as Paytm’s stock more than doubled from record lows of Rs 609 in February 2024 to near Rs 1,300.

items.title: IMF warns Asia could face challenges if dollar rallies and rates rise
items.description: Asia may see its resilience to US tariffs tested if a rally in the dollar and a rebound in low interest rates lead to tighter financial conditions, according to Krishna Srinivasan, director of the IMF’s Asia and Pacific Department. Current favourable financial conditions have allowed countries to manage the impact of higher U.S. tariffs effectively. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: BSE shares rally 15% in a month. Is this the start of a new bull run or just a technical rebound?
items.description: After weeks of regulatory uncertainty, BSE shares have rebounded sharply, rising 15% in a month as fears over the weekly expiry rule eased. On Thursday, the stock climbed nearly 2% to Rs 2,533.70 before settling at Rs 2,486.50. Renewed stability has sparked buying in market infrastructure stocks, highlighting a measured recovery rather than a purely relief-driven bounce.

items.title: Vedanta, Hindalco & Nalco shares climb up to 5%. Here’s what’s fuelling the rally
items.description: Shares of Vedanta, Hindalco, and Nalco jumped as LME aluminium prices surpassed $2,850/tonne, fueled by tight global supply and disruptions like Century Aluminum’s production slowdown in Iceland.

items.title: Federal Bank approves Rs 6,200 crore warrant issue to Blackstone; stock up 2%
items.description: Federal Bank approved issuing Rs 6,196 crore convertible warrants to Blackstone’s Asia II Topco XIII, enabling a potential 10% stake, boosting shares 2.2% to Rs 232.25.

items.title: Why Indian IT is emerging as contra bet
items.description: Indian IT, despite recent underperformance, offers a contrarian opportunity with strong fundamentals, robust cash flows, and high dividend yields. Moderate valuations and operational resilience position the sector for a potential re-rating, making it an attractive avenue for patient investors seeking relative value in equities.

items.title: Retail holdings dip in 62 midcaps in Q2; ‘Sell-on-Rise’ ploy seen in Delhivery, Paytm and 31 other stocks
items.description: Retail investors trimmed holdings in 62 midcap stocks in Q2FY26, reflecting a ‘sell-on-rise’ strategy amid strong gains. Delhivery, Paytm, Dixon Technologies, and APL Apollo Tubes saw notable stake cuts even as returns surged. Experts suggest long-term SIPs for sustained midcap exposure.

items.title: 7 smallcap stocks with double-digit Sales growth in Q2: one turned multibagger
items.description: The earnings season is gaining momentum, with 108 smallcap companies reporting their September quarter results. A deeper dive into the numbers reveals that 42 firms achieved over 10% year-on-year sales growth, after excluding banks and financial companies. This indicates a segment of smallcaps continuing to expand their businesses despite market volatility.Focusing further on profit-making companies narrows the list to 36 standout performers. Notably, seven of these stocks have surged more than 50%, and one has become a multibagger over the past year. These results highlight the quiet outperformers in the smallcap space, companies that are delivering both robust growth and strong investor returns. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: Epack Prefab Technologies shares soar 30% in 2 days after strong Q2 earnings
items.description: Epack Prefab Technologies shares saw a significant jump. This followed strong Q2FY26 results. Net profit rose over 100 percent. Revenue from operations also increased substantially. The company operates in prefab and packaging businesses. Its order book remains robust. Manufacturing capacity has also been expanded. The stock now trades above its IPO price.

items.title: Sebi bars 13 individuals from securities market for front running
items.description: India's market regulator has banned 13 individuals from securities trading for front-running trades placed by three trusts. The Securities and Exchange Board of India found these individuals made illegal gains by trading ahead of the trusts' transactions between January 2021 and October 2022. Penalties ranging from 500,000 to 1.5 million rupees were also imposed.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei rises on tech boost, set for eighth weekly gain in nine
items.description: Japan's Nikkei share average surged over 1% on Friday, driven by tech stocks and anticipation of fiscal stimulus from Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's new government. The index was poised for an eighth weekly gain in nine, with investors scooping up technology shares that had recently declined. SoftBank Group and chip-related Advantest were among the top gainers.

items.title: Ashish Kacholia-backed stock surges 26% in 5 sessions. What’s fuelling the rally today?
items.description: Jain Resource Recycling shares jumped 9% to a 52-week high of Rs 401.30, extending a five-day rally after Q2 FY26 net profit soared 88% to Rs 98.6 crore and revenue rose 52% to Rs 2,113.7 crore.

items.title: HUL delivers 4% PAT growth in Q2; brokerages see recovery, set target price up to Rs 3,240
items.description: Hindustan Unilever (HUL) reported its Q2 FY26 consolidated net profit at Rs 2,685 crore, marking a 3.6% increase from Rs 2,591 crore in the same period last year. The rise in profit includes a one-off exceptional gain of Rs 273 crore, attributed to the resolution of legacy tax matters between UK and Indian authorities.The company’s EBITDA margin stood at 23%, with revenue performance moderately impacted by a GST-led transition and subdued volume growth. Despite these mixed signals, several brokerage firms have released their views on HUL’s performance, outlook, and valuation. Here’s what each brokerage is saying post the Q2 results:

items.title: Explained: Why Tata Motors changed its name to Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles (TMPV)
items.description: Tata Motors has officially split into two companies: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd (TMPV) and a new commercial vehicle entity, TMLCV. Shareholders receive one TMLCV share per Tata Motors share. The demerger separates passenger, electric, and JLR operations from commercial vehicles, aiming for operational efficiency, faster decision-making, and value unlocking.

items.title: India’s evolving startup funding landscape: Nithin Kamath reflects on VC growth and entrepreneurial momentum
items.description: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath reflected on India’s 15-year startup evolution, highlighting how the VC ecosystem matured from family-funded ventures to global capital-driven innovation, aided by digital expansion, education, and nationwide entrepreneurial aspiration.

items.title: How Shankar Sharma's house help bought Mumbai apartment without investing in stocks
items.description: Ace investor Shankar Sharma shared how his house help, who followed his two-decade-old advice to invest monthly in gold and land, recently bought a stunning Mumbai apartment—underscoring the timeless power of disciplined, long-term investing over speculation.

items.title: Nifty to hit 30,000 by Diwali 2026, says Deepak Shenoy; 5 bold predictions
items.description: Deepak Shenoy of Capital Mind forecasts a dramatic 2025 with Nifty potentially hitting 30,000, gold plunging 20%, and a US recession restricting Fed rate cuts. He expects India’s growth to stay robust, driven by domestic investors.

items.title: Financial services sector: In this phase of upmove, is a basket better than focusing on one? 12 stocks with upside potential of up to 46%
items.description: With the bulls back in play, is it time to look at financial services stocks once again? Before we answer that, let’s ask ourselves three questions. One: Is the sector better placed after the clean-up by the RBI? Two: In a growing economy like India, can it be that this sector does not grow? And three: Can FIIs, whose selling caused the recent underperformance of stocks from the sector, again pick up these stocks when they return? The answer to the first question is ‘yes’. And it is a ‘no’ for the second question. The answer to the third question is still open.

items.title: European shares gain on US-China trade optimism, upbeat earnings
items.description: European shares climbed on Friday, as signs of easing U.S.-China trade conflicts and a raft of positive corporate earnings boosted investor sentiment.

items.title: F&O Radar| Deploy Short Strangle in Nifty for gains from cautious, range-bound trading view
items.description: Nifty50, after breaching 26,000, shows short-term overbought signals and is likely to enter a consolidation phase. Experts suggest deploying a Short Strangle options strategy to profit from range-bound movement, with support near 25,500 and resistance around 26,200–26,300.

items.title: $7 billion deals in banks, NBFCs in 2025. Sign of banking reforms ahead?
items.description: The flood of foreign money into India’s financial sector this year, over $7 billion and counting, is more than a capital infusion. It’s starting to look like the early rumblings of a structural reset in Indian banking.
